shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” (hand a) I-1) Story of the family of Adam (fols. 81ra-85va) I-2) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus”: 38 miracles (consists of three parts, each starting from a new folio: 1) fols. 85va-90v, 71r-80v, 63r-70v, 2) fols. 53r-62v, 43r-52v, 33r-42v, 3) 23r-30v, 15r-22v, 7r-14v, 1r-1va) I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd lä-mäläkotǝkä “I worship Thy Godhead…” (fols. 2ra-4rb) II) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus”: 29 miracles (hand b) (fols. 209r-216v, 185r-192v, 193r-200v, 201r-208v, 177r-184v, 169r-176v, 161r-168v, 151r-160v, 143r-150v, 135r-142v, 125r-134v, 117r-124v, 101r-108v, 109r-116v, 91r-100rb)
Part 2) in Text I-2) is preceded by a short introduction (fol. 53r: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ንቅድም፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ጸሒፈ፡ ተአምሪሁ...) and followed by Additiones 1 (a hymn to Jesus Christ) and 2. Text I-3) is followed by Additio 3 (a magic prayer)
Additiones 1-4.

originlink.xlink:title: Däbrä Sahәl Qәddus Mikaʾel Bet Mäḵaʿ / DSM

locationlink.xlink:title: Däbrä Sahәl Qәddus Mikaʾel Bet Mäḵaʿ / DSM

copyists.copyist: Mentioned in part 3) of Text I-2, on fol. 1rb (hand a).

donors.donor: In part 3) of Text I-2, the commissioner Wäldä ʾAragawi is mentioned on fol. 1rb and in the supplication formulas throughout the text (e.g., fols. 7rb, 9rb, 14ra). Zä-Giyorgis is mentioned in the supplication formulas in parts 1) and 2) of Text I-2 (e.g., fols. 31rb, 33va, 34rb, 53ra, 90va etc.). In the supplication formulas of Text II (e.g., fols. 98vb, 100rb (before the colophon), 102rb, 109ra, etc.), the name of the original donor (apparently Wäldä ʾarägawi) is corrected to Wäldä Mikaʾel, sometimes the names of Wäldä Mikaʾel’s relatives are mentioned: his mother ʿAmätä Krǝstos (fols. 109ra, 114vb); his father Wäldä Krǝstos (fols. 128rb, 144ra, 191va, 200va), his son Zä-Śǝllase (fols. 153vb, 166rb, 172rb). The name Wälätta Mikaʾel appears on fols. 102, 128rb, 131ra, 150va, 196rb, written over the erased text. The name Täsfa Śǝllase appear on fol. 153vb. The name Wälättä Krǝstos appears on fols. 186va, 190ra, written over the erased text.

txstates.txstate: The quires are rebound in the wrong order; many leaves are damaged with water, stained with dirt or worn out, on certain folios the text is difficult to read; tear amended on fol.78.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex. Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the first eleven quires (in the central part, two pairs on each quire), Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: I(6/fols. 1r-6v) - II(8/fols. 7r-14v) - III(8/fols. 15r-22v) - IV(8/fols. 23r-30v) - V(2/fols. 31r-32v) - VI(10/fols. 33r-42v) - VII(10/fols. 43r-52v) - VIII(10/fols. 53r-62v) - IX(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; s.l.: 6, stub after 3/fols. 63r-70v) - X(10/fols. 71r-80v) - XI(10/fols. 81r-90v) - XII(10/fols. 91r-100v) - XIII(8/fols. 101r-108v) - XIV(8/fols. 109r-116v) - XV(8/fols. 117r-124v) - XVI(10; fols. 125r-134v) - XVII(8/fols. 135r-142v) - XVIII(8/fols. 143r-150v) - XIX(10/fols. 151r-160v) - XX(8/fols. 161r-168v) - XXI(8/fols. 169r-176v) - XXII(8/fols. 177r-184v) - XXIII(8/fols. 185r-192v) - XXIV(8/fols. 193r-200v) - XXV(8/fols. 201r-208v) - XXVI(8/fols. 209r-216v) The quires were rebound in the wrong order and apparently belong to two manuscripts (of approximately same age), both containing “Miracles of Jesus”. The correct order is as follows: Hand a: XI-X-IX-(VIII-VII-VI-V)-IV-III-II-I Hand b: XXVI- XXIII-XXIV-XXV-XXII-XXI-XX-XIX-XVIII-XVII-XVI-XV-XIII-XIV-XII

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

Pricking and ruling are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand:
Hand a: fols. 1r-90v Hand b: fols. 91r-216v
Hand a: careful; tendency to left-sloping shapes. Hand b: neat, careful, well-trained; tendency to square shapes.

otherdetails.otherdetail: The miracles are usually introduced with words täʾamǝr “miracle”, nägär “speech“ or täʾamǝr wa-mankǝr “miracle and wonder“. Rubrication is sometimes done in a secondary hand (e.g., on fols. 35va, 47va, 47vb, 49vb)

colophon.tran: This is the book which he [Wäldä Mikaˀel, mentioned in the preceding supplication formula] gave to Qəddus Mikaˀel Betä Mäḵaˁ in order to find reward in the kingdom of heaven forever and ever. Amen.
colophon.det: Written over the erased text, presumably of the original colophon, in a hand similar to that of the Text II.

additional.cont: Fol. 31v: A hymn to Jesus Christ.
additional.det: Written in the same hand as Text I.

additional.cont: Fol. 32v: A note on loan (ዋህስ), mostly illegible.
Fols. 4vb-5rb: Protective prayer against snow or hail (bäräd).
Fol. 100v: A prayer over a deceased (ˀƎndrəyas ?), followed by a short hymn to George the Martyr. The title ዋዜማ is written on the upper margin.

extras.extra: - Scribbles: fols. 5v, 21r, 50r - Omitted letters or words written interlineally, in the main hand: fols. 7ra, 15ra, 17ra, 21vb, 29ra, 29vb, 40ra, 46rb, 98rb - Correction through erasure: fol. 7va; - Space for rubrication left unfilled on fol.199va

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Titles of miracles or feasts indicating respective readings are written in the upper margin, in a secondary (recent) hand: ትንሣኤ: fol. 115r ዘሆሣዕና፡ fol. 153vb ዘሰንበት፡ fol. 172rb ደብረ፡ ዘይ[ት]; fol. 196v ይቤ፡ ዮሃንስ: fol. 204r
